Hi, I am using the RichTextEditor on a page with an ascx header control, on the header then are asp link buttons. When I click one of the link buttons I get the "potentially dangerous Request.Form value was detected from the client" error because the text in the RichTextEditor contains html tags (depending on what I put in the editor). I know that the text needs to be encoded before the page is posted back but am not sure how to go about this. I don't want to turn page validation off for security reasons.
 
Somebody else created this page but they have now left the company so I am a bit frustrated as I don't think this page has ever worked properly.
 
This is my link button on the ascx control - 
<asp:LinkButton ID="lnkBtnAdminMenuUserAdmin" runat="server" PostBackUrl="~/Secure/Users.aspx" Text="User Administration" CssClass="MenuLinkButton" ForeColor="white" Width="150px"></asp:LinkButton>
 
This is the editor declaration on the main page -
<%@ Register Assembly="RichTextEditor" Namespace="AjaxControls" TagPrefix="cc1" %>
<cc1:RichTextEditor ID="RTF" runat="server"  />
 
Any help would be appreciated.
